name: USCoreSpecimenProfile
title: US Core Specimen Profile
description: This profile sets minimum expectations for the Specimen resource to record, search, and fetch "substances being sampled or tested. (e.g., nasopharyngeal swab, whole blood, serum, urine, wound swab)" associated with a patient to promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation.  It identifies which core elements, extensions, vocabularies, and value sets **SHALL** be present in the resource and constrains the way the elements are used when using this profile.  It provides the floor for standards development for specific use cases.

elements.name: id
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: Id for specimen.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: accessionIdentifier
elements.description: The identifier assigned by the lab when accessioning specimen(s). This is not necessarily the same as the specimen identifier, depending on local lab procedures.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.description: The availability of the specimen.

binding.description: Codes providing the status/availability of a specimen.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: type
elements.short: (USCDI) Kind of material that forms the specimen
elements.description: The kind of material that forms the specimen.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: subject
elements.short: (USCDI) The patient where the specimen came from.
elements.description: Where the specimen came from. This may be from patient(s), from a location (e.g., the source of an environmental sample), or a sampling of a substance or a device.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: receivedTime
elements.short: The time when specimen was received for processing
elements.description: Time when specimen was received for processing or testing.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: parent
elements.short: Specimen from which this specimen originated
elements.description: Reference to the parent (source) specimen which is used when the specimen was either derived from or a component of another specimen.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: request
elements.description: Details concerning a service request that required a specimen to be collected.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: collection
elements.description: Details concerning the specimen collection.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: collector
elements.description: Person who collected the specimen.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: collected[x]
elements.description: Time when specimen was collected from subject - the physiologically relevant time.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: duration
elements.short: How long it took to collect specimen
elements.description: The span of time over which the collection of a specimen occurred.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: quantity
elements.description: The quantity of specimen collected; for instance the volume of a blood sample, or the physical measurement of an anatomic pathology sample.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: method
elements.description: A coded value specifying the technique that is used to perform the procedure.

binding.description: The  technique that is used to perform the procedure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: bodySite
elements.description: Anatomical location from which the specimen was collected (if subject is a patient). This is the target site.  This element is not used for environmental specimens.

binding.description: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: fastingStatus[x]
elements.short: Whether or how long patient abstained from food and/or drink
elements.description: Abstinence or reduction from some or all food, drink, or both, for a period of time prior to sample collection.

binding.description: Codes describing the fasting status of the patient.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: processing
elements.description: Details concerning processing and processing steps for the specimen.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: description
elements.description: Textual description of procedure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: procedure
elements.short: Indicates the treatment step  applied to the specimen
elements.description: A coded value specifying the procedure used to process the specimen.

binding.description: Type indicating the technique used to process the specimen.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: additive
elements.short: Material used in the processing step
elements.description: Material used in the processing step.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: time[x]
elements.short: Date and time of specimen processing
elements.description: A record of the time or period when the specimen processing occurred.  For example the time of sample fixation or the period of time the sample was in formalin.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: container
elements.description: The container holding the specimen.  The recursive nature of containers; i.e. blood in tube in tray in rack is not addressed here.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: Id for container. There may be multiple; a manufacturer's bar code, lab assigned identifier, etc. The container ID may differ from the specimen id in some circumstances.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: description
elements.description: Textual description of the container.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: type
elements.short: Kind of container directly associated with specimen
elements.description: The type of container associated with the specimen (e.g. slide, aliquot, etc.).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: capacity
elements.description: The capacity (volume or other measure) the container may contain.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: one of: SAC 16, SAC17 and SAC 20, or SAC 21 and SAC 20

elements.name: specimenQuantity
elements.description: The quantity of specimen in the container; may be volume, dimensions, or other appropriate measurements, depending on the specimen type.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: additive[x]
elements.description: Introduced substance to preserve, maintain or enhance the specimen. Examples: Formalin, Citrate, EDTA.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: condition
elements.description: A mode or state of being that describes the nature of the specimen.

binding.description: Codes describing the state of the specimen.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: note
elements.description: To communicate any details or issues about the specimen or during the specimen collection. (for example: broken vial, sent with patient, frozen).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
